programme.title: WTA Finals

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Bogota
programme.desc: Defending champion Camila Osorio targets a third trophy on home soil as the two-time Bogota winner takes on 32-year-old Polish qualifier Katarzyna Kawa in the final. (06.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.title: Federer v Agassi 2005

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Canadian Pickers

programme.title: Canadian Pickers

programme.title: Canadian Pickers

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.desc: Stairway to Pawn: Rick checks out a bass guitar signed by Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones and The Who's John Entwistle, but is he all about that bass? (S17, ep 11)

programme.title: Storage Wars Texas

programme.desc: Biosecurity eye rare artefacts from Canada. Two travellers try to outsmart Immigration and there's a sticky situation in Customs. (S12, ep 5)

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: An irate tourist causes havoc. In Biosecurity, officer Renee uncovers some unwelcome hitchhikers. (S12, ep 6)

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: A family of foodies cook up some trouble in Biosecurity. Meanwhile, a dubious Christmas gift sent from the US raises eyebrows. (S12, ep 7)

programme.title: The Pingu Show
programme.desc: Pingu and Pinga Go Camping / Pingu Makes a Splash: Pingu and Pinga spend a night in a tent. Pingu tries to dive off the highest ice-shape and impress his friends. (S1, ep 15)

programme.title: The Pingu Show
programme.desc: Pingu and the Rubberband Plane / Pingu and the Daily Igloo: Pingu sends a wind-up plane whizzing through town. Pingu gets a paper round and can't wait to start delivering! (S1, ep 16)

programme.title: Play Your Pets Right
programme.desc: Fudge vs Lily, Harlso vs Biscuits: Guinea pigs Fudge and Lily battle it out by speed-eating kale, and Harlso the dachshund tries to balance 16 ginger biscuits on his head. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Where's Wally
programme.desc: Big in Japan: When Odlulu zaps Fritz with the Mega Monster Key, he grows super-sized and tries to eat all the noodles in Tokyo. (S1, ep 14)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Host: When Dr Crusher develops feelings for a Trill ambassador, they are complicated by what she learns about the Trills' existence. (S4, Ep 23)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Mind's Eye: As he prepares for shore leave, Geordi is kidnapped and, through brainwashing, groomed for a new existence as an assassin. (S4, Ep 24)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: In Theory: Data discovers some of the pitfalls of romance when he becomes involved with a crewmate as the ship passes through a dark matter nebula. (S4, Ep 25)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Redemption - Part 1: When war breaks out, threatening the whole of the Klingon Empire, Worf has a difficult decision to make. (S4, Ep 26)

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Redemption - Part 2: Captain Picard and his crew are determined to prevent the Romulans from winning the Klingon Civil War, in which Worf is also entangled. (S5, Ep 1)

programme.title: FILM: Prancer: A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Gloria and her recently widowed grandfather Bud befriend a mysterious reindeer when the family gathers for Christmas. Family drama. (2022)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom Of Plants
programme.desc: David Attenborough concludes his absorbing journey around London's Kew Gardens, as he discovers how some plants have evolved to shed their dependency on water. (3 of 3)

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.desc: Jungle River: Young gladiators earn their stripes in dense tropical forests. Stand back as a poison dart frog launches a toxic barrage and observe a jaguar-caiman turf war. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Predators
programme.desc: Polar Bear: On the shores of Canada's Hudson Bay, a community of polar bears are battling to survive. (2 of 5)

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.desc: Love From Hell: An investigation becomes personal as James suddenly disappears following a jazz night. Then there is the small matter of a body... (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Rob & Romesh Vs Anthony Joshua
programme.desc: .. Revisited. The boys meet heavyweight champ Anthony Joshua, watch him in action and chat to his boxer mate Tony Bellew. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Ricky Gervais - Politics
programme.desc: Recorded live in London in 2004, Ricky Gervais delivers another smash-hit show covering everything from being mistaken for Johnny Vegas to politics and beyond. Strong language/adult humour.

programme.title: Nothing To Declare
programme.desc: Cameras join officers from Australia's airports, harbours and mail services as they protect the nation from drug-smugglers, illegal products and unusual creepy-crawlies. (S10, ep 3)
